comments:
When I tried to create an Axis2 bottom-up Web service using SimpleBean (as defined in http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/jst/components/ws/scenarios/bu/01.html), I can invoke most of the methods except I'm getting an exception with returnVector and returnVectorArray.

For returnHastable, I'm getting:

<return>
  <empty xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">false</empty>
  <empty xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">false</empty>
</return>

For returnMap, I'm getting:

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
- <soapenv:Body>
- <returnMapResponse xmlns:ns="http://bean/xsd">
  <ns:return xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:nil="true" /> 
  </returnMapResponse>
  </soapenv:Body>
  </soapenv:Envelope>

These are likely Axis2 bugs or limitations.  If they are bugs, please open a JIRA defect.  These methods are not handled well for Axis1 either.  We actually have JAX-RPC validation code that is called early in the Axis1 extension that checks for these and provide warnings.  Axis2 might want to do similar checking if they indeed would cause runtime problem.  You should consider removing them from the test case as well.
